New Records: The Yankees won the game 4-3 in 11 innings with a game-ending infield single by Jazz Chisholm Jr.
Aaron Judge scored the winning run with a bunt groundout in the 11th inning after a fielder's choice.
Key Match Events: The game went into extra innings with a 4-3 final score after 11 innings.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit an infield single to shortstop to score Berti and win the game in the bottom of the 11th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees and Royals were playing at Yankee Stadium with Luis Gil starting for the Yankees and Cole Ragans for the Royals.
The game was part of a series where the Royals had already won two of the first three games.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees' manager Aaron Boone expressed relief after the win, saying it was a good team effort.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. praised the team's resilience in the 11th inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had a attendance of 40,080 fans at Yankee Stadium.
The umpires for the game were Alan Porter, Sean Barber, Austin Jones, and Will Little.
Others: The Royals had 8 hits and 1 home run, while the Yankees had 6 hits and 1 home run.
The game's outcome was decided in the 11th inning with a key defensive play by the Yankees.
